result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:05 PM Defendant GARY S WILLIAMS appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mark s Williams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Joe Furnstahl appears for bond only.  Defendant does qualify for public defender services.  Remarks by Atty. Furnstahl.  Atty. Williams requests $5,000 cash to be split between the 3 cases.  Response by Atty. Furnstahl.  Court makes its findings and orders $750.00 cash bond on each case.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant GARY S WILLIAMS appeared by video, in custody. Defendant is eligible for public defender services, but no one has been appointed yet.  Bond remains in effect.  Defendant requests bond reduction in 22CF383.  Remarks by the defendant.  Response by Atty. Nelson.  Court makes its findings and amends the bond to $5,000 signature with same conditions in 22CF383 ONLY.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Eligible for SPD services

22CF335 & 22CF383 - 11:42 am. Defendant GARY S WILLIAMS in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. qualifies for a public defender but one has not yet been appointed to represent. The Court gives 2 options to the Defendant relating to today's PH and counsel. Option 1) Waive right to an atty. for todays purposes only and hold the PH or Option 2) Waive the time limits for holding the PH and wait for counsel to be appointed to represent the Defendant. Defendant picks option: 2.
Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
